title: By 1970, could any album have  strong language not cut unlike with The Doors 1967’s The End? - Quora

response.answer_text: John Lennon's first solo album “Plastic Ono Band" from 1970 is known for its rawness and brutal honesty. It is considered by many to be the best solo album released by any of The Beatles! The song “Working Class Hero" features two clearly sung “F-bombs" and “I Found Out" has the line “I see you sitting there with your c**k in your hand…”! Pretty raw stuff for 1970! Being an 8 year old Beatles fan at the time, I begged my mom to buy it for me at the “TG&Y" store (anybody remember those?). Imagine my parents surprise when they heard those songs coming from my room! They took the album away from me but it didn't really matter anyway because at 8 I didn't understand the anger and raw honesty of the album. Of course by my late teens I realized it was a brilliant album and still do!
